metadata.title: CPA - Inteli - Institute of Technology and Leadership

content_blocks.text: The Institute of Technology and Leadership's (Inteli) Own Evaluation Commission (CPA) acts as the body responsible for coordinating, conducting and coordinating the internal institutional evaluation process. This collegiate body is also responsible for guiding, systematizing and providing information to the Sponsoring Entity and to the National Higher Education Evaluation System - SINAES.
content_blocks.subsection: The Institute of Technology and Leadership's (Inteli) Own Evaluation Commission (CPA) acts as the body responsible for coordinating, conducting and coordinating the internal institutional evaluation process. This collegiate body is also responsible for guiding, systematizing and providing information to the Sponsoring Entity and to the National Higher Education Evaluation System - SINAES.

content_blocks.text: Objective of the CPA within Inteli
content_blocks.subsection: Objective of the CPA within Inteli

content_blocks.text: The CPA's objectives are to implement a culture of evaluation in a reflective, systematic and continuous process about the institutional reality; to subsidize and guide institutional management in its social, political, philosophical and ethical dimensions of action and management, to promote the necessary adjustments to raise its standard of performance, and to permanently improve the quality and relevance of the activities carried out.
content_blocks.subsection: Objective of the CPA within Inteli

content_blocks.text: The Evaluation Commission (CPA) is responsible for monitoring and adhering to the following regulations:

The Evaluation Commission (CPA) is responsible for monitoring and adhering to the following regulations:

- Law No. 10.861 of April 14, 2004
- Ordinance No. 2.051 of July 9, 2004
- INEP/CONAES Technical Note 65
What is the role of the CPA?
content_blocks.subsection: What is the role of the CPA?

content_blocks.text: Develop creative solutions to real market problems
content_blocks.subsection: Develop creative solutions to real market problems

content_blocks.text: This collegiate body is responsible for Inteli's institutional evaluation within the scope of SINAES, observing the dimensions set out in Article 3 of Law No. 10.861/2004, and must monitor the implementation of the Institutional Development Plan - PDI, especially with regard to strategic actions and perennial lines of action, as well as the external evaluation processes carried out by the regulatory bodies.
